name: 42 Dugg
description: '''Dion Marquise Hayes''' (born November 25, 1994), known professionally as '''42 Dugg''', is an American rapper and songwriter from [[Detroit]], [[Michigan]]. He signed with [[Yo Gotti]] and [[Lil Baby]]'s respective labels, [[Collective Music Group]] (CMG) and [[Lil Baby#2015–2018: Career beginnings and Harder Than Ever|Glass Window Entertainment]] (previously known as 4PF), through a [[joint venture]] with [[Interscope Records]] in 2019. He is best known for his collaborations with the latter, with whom he co-performed the 2020 songs "[[We Paid]]" and "[[Grace (Lil Baby and 42 Dugg song)|Grace]]" — the former peaked within the top ten of the [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]] and received [[RIAA certification|quintuple platinum]] certification by the [[Recording Industry Association of America]] (RIAA). His second mixtape, ''Young & Turnt 2'' (2020) was met with critical acclaim and marked his debut on the [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]]. His 2021 singles, "[[4 Da Gang]]" (with [[Roddy Ricch]]) and "[[Maybach (42 Dugg song)|Maybach]]" (featuring [[Future (rapper)|Future]]) both received [[RIAA certification|gold]] certifications and preceded his fourth mixtape ''[[Free Dem Boyz]]'' (2021), which peaked at number eight on the ''Billboard'' 200.
